Reviews.Title: “Perfect little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TheodorArnason
Reviews.Content: I had been advised to ask for a room overlooking the garden. It was always peaceful and quiet, with birds chirping (although occasional inexplicable rumbling from the floor above). We came and went for four days as if it was our own house and never saw anyone else, except the manager who kindly checked us in. The location can't be beat if you are doing the art musuems and enjoy the more peaceful restaurants on Calle Huertas.

Reviews.Title: “Weirdly nice”
Reviews.Author: SkyblueAmy
Reviews.Content: I was going to Madrid on business and needed a place to stay for 2 nights. I arrived earlier than expected but the chap on reception was really friendly and showed me straight to my room. The room was basic and the bathroom was so tiny that when you sat on the loo your knees practically touched the opposite wall but it was spotlessly clean. As I only planned to sleep there it was perfect for me. Unfortunately I was ill on the Thursday and couldn't leave the room. Surprisingly being confined to the room didn't drive me insane. The tv was adequate and the room was weirdly cosy in it's own way. I had the best 2 nights sleep in a long time! Oh and the shower pressure was great! The man on reception (who I presume is the manager as I never saw any other members of staff) was absolutely lovely. The hotel is in a great location with just a short walk to the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen-Bornemisza museums, the Parque del Retiro, and the Plaza Puerta del Sol. There is a Gama mini-mart on the same street, but I used the Vips round the corner more. The Banco de Espana metro stop is about a 5-10min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true.”
Reviews.Author: Shona B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple of my friends and we all enjoyed it. The staff were very nice, the room was basic, but adequate. All the positive reviews that I read on Trip Advisor were true.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite b&b in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_sLondon
Reviews.Content: Really good value for the location, friendly owner, nice rooms and such homy feeling! Been twice and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Low Key, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: 1potato2
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed here for three nights in a pair of triple rooms just after New Years. It was perfect for us! Don't know if the triples are just larger/nicer than other rooms, but we were quite happy with the decor, etc. and the rooms were next to each other at the end of the hallway, so very quiet. The lobby was very homey looking, but maybe due to the holidays we never saw anyone there except when we rang to check in the first day. This was the wonderful thing about the place--it was so quiet, like our own private hotel. We only saw the desk clerk when we checked in, and on the night before we were to check out, he came to tell us he would not be available early in the morning so very conveniently had us settle the accounts at that time.The rooms were cleaned and made up every day when we returned. No elevators, but this is to be expected in Europe at this type of hotel. No street noise to speak of--it was a perfect stay, at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good value”
Reviews.Author: skoolzout4ever
Reviews.Content: Hotel Armesto was a small, reasonably-priced, well located hotel on a fairly quiet (for a big city like Madrid) street. Very TYPICAL set up with no elevator (located on American 2nd floor but European 1st floor) inside a multiple usage building (another hotel was located on an upper floor, apartments, etc.) Typical entrance . . . often hotel entrances are not that great looking and can look rather shabby. European facades are old . . . but insides can be lovely. Good security with 3 keys . . . outside door lock (not always the case in Europe) as well as hotel entrance and room. Decor was nothing special but clean and comfortable. Renovated bathroom - no soap - but something new to me in European hotels . . . a hair dryer!! ! Small balcony and "French doors." WiFi available but sketchy. We requested a room NOT overlooking the street but didn't get one. Perhaps it was the language barrier. We had little exchange with the proprietors who were lovely but spoke no English. We were there in November so a/c was unncessary. As a long time European traveler (40 yrs) this hotel was typical and fine for sleeping. I am always on a budget and like to meet locals . . . so this hotel was about what I expected . . . and better than others I've stayed at in other large cities. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location beats the room”
Reviews.Author: HelloMartinReed
Reviews.Content: - Two flights of stairs up, no lift - Decor mismatched but all appeared clean and satisfactory - Quiet night's sleep - Easy to walk everywhere from the location - Good for a quick trip but NOT a romantic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location. lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: BristolKiki
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2011. The location is fantastic, on a very quite street but right round the corner from Plaza Santa Ana which is one of the main nightlife centres. The style of the hotel is a little dated but everything was clean and comfortable. We found the hotel to be very quiet, heard very little from any of the other rooms. The gentleman on reception didn't speak much English but was really friendly and welcoming. The only problem that we had was that it was sometimes a bit difficult to open the 'middle door' (the door to the hostal, accessed once inside the building). If you just want somewhere clean and comfortable, that isn't too much money and is in a good location I would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap hotel.. BUT spend the money for the window”
Reviews.Author: cloglisci
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a strange location inside of another building. There is no elevator to bring up luggage. It is walking distance from the train station. It is also close to a street(Huertas) with bars for night. La Tina is a better neighborhood for nightlife. It feels much safer and has a mixed age crowd. Our room on the otherhand, was smaller then the bathroom. The beds were sooooooooo uncomfortable. We barely slept. The most important, get a room with a window. We did not have one and it was summer; it was extremely hot and could not sleep. There was no ventilation. If your looking for comfort, DONT STAY HERE! If your looking for a cheap place and dont care, STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, simple, cheap and great location”
Reviews.Author: Johno2go
Reviews.Content: A really nice, simple hotel, very reasonably priced and in an excellent central location, and very quiet road. Lovely place, very friendly owner who spoke no English but not a problem for us as we had a Spanish speaker in our party. Not really like a hotel, more like a room in a large apartment. No wifi but we knew this in advance. Very clean, and well serviced. A really nice little bar opposite serving delicious food, a small supermarket a couple of doors away, the Metro 10 mins walk away and plenty of excellent tapas bars nearby. Can't fault the place. If you want something well priced, quiet and well located and no wifi isn't an issue for you, give Armesto serious consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money !”
Reviews.Author: rubiaescobar
Reviews.Content: "Simple" but very clean and fantastic location, just one block from the Prado Museum and 7 minutes walking from "Banco de Espana" metro station. The rooms are clean, with small showers, efficient heat, cable TV, small balconies overlooking the street, free internet, air condition and private bathroom. Would stay in Armesto again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Danyellow
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were very tired from our long plane ride into Spain. Thankfully, the man at this hostal didn't hesitate to check us in and allow us in our reserved room hours before check-in time. My only complaint is the strong smell of lemon-scented wood polish. I'm pretty sensitive to that kind of thing though. Everything else was very lovely, and the price and location was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “excellent on all counts”
Reviews.Author: blavine
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Hostal Cervantes, around the corner, but it and the building next door were under extensive rennovation, and our room was intolerable (noise and dust). The Cervantes' brother runs Armesto and he called and got us the perfect room there. By all means get a room overlooking the interior garden - it was very quiet and the room was charming. There is free WiFi, which we really appreciated, and the owner was extremely helpful in booking our ride to the airport (and then calling again to change it when I realized I had made a mistake on our departure time). Be sure to have a drink in the rotunda of the Palace Hotel, a couple of minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: azo49008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hostal Armesto for four days in May. It was a little more posh than I had expected for the price. The reception area is very nicely appointed, as are the rooms. Our bathroom was clean and well-maintained. We had a large closet and a small writing desk. For the most part it was quiet. The street that runs in front of it is mostly residential, but there is a restaurant across the street and a bar several doors down. The large windows are double glazed I believe, and it really blocked out any street noise that might have been an issue. The only night that was a problem was the night Real Madrid lost the match against Barcelona to decide which team was going on to the European championships. There was some major rowdiness going on down the street from soccer fans (drunken, depressed and angry soccer fans from the losing team I suspect) which neither the thick windows nor ear plugs could totally drown out. BUT, that being said, we didn't have a problem with noise any of the other nights we stayed there. They also have courtyard rooms available. The door to one of the courtyard rooms was open when it was being cleaned after the previous guest had checked out and the courtyard view looked pleasant. The owner is friendly and attentive but unobtrusive. The lobby is very nicely scented - with what, I'm not sure, but it's a very pleasant smell - but it can be strong at times. I mention this as just a heads up to anyone with sensitve asthma that can be triggered by strongly perfumed scents. The Prado and Retiro park are a very quick walk (10 mins) from the hotel, as is the Plaza Mayor, Puerta del Sol and other centrally located Madrid attractions. There are also some decent tapas places scattered throughout the neighborhood. We'll stay again when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a fantastic little hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jen3eb2
Reviews.Content: don't let the exterior fool you, this is a fantastic little hotel!! it is located on the second floor of a building (no elevator thus not accessible to the disabled). the area is pretty quiet; i didn't experience any noise from the street. some rooms face an interior courtyard/garden which is absolutely charming. the rooms/bathrooms are basic but immaculately clean. full western style shower/tub, fresh towels given daily, plenty of storage space, in room safe, television, etc. need to bring your own hair dryer and there's no in-house restaurant, though you can buy soft drinks, i believe, from the attendant at the front desk). even for someone who is regarded as a bit of a travel "princess" this hotel was completely satisfactory. also the staff is incredibly warm and friendly (though not exactly english speaking...bring a spanish phrase book and you'll be fine). it is less than a five minute walk to the prado, the thyssen-bornemisza, a multitude of restaurants, and sevilla metro station (by the way, airport is accessible by public transit....it's about a 20-25 min ride with two line changes), etc. absolutely amazing location at a fantastic price (about 55 euro or $92 canadian per room per night, double occupancy). highly reccomended (unless you're one to spend your entire trip in a hotel instead of touring the city).

Reviews.Title: “Hostal Armesto - Good value but with noise in the morning”
Reviews.Author: LouBoston
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of reach on this site and chose Hostal Armesto. I rate it highly except for a clacking noise of some sort of machinery somewhere located nearby - it would start in the morning around 8;00 a.m. and last for a half hour to an hour. Other than that the hotel has a lot of pluses...I liked the location and it was very quiet at night as I had a room not facing the street. Even facing the street, I think would not be bad ( maybe you do not here that machinery sould there ) as the street has little traffic. The location is near the Prado and a couple of blocks from the metro. If I went again, I think I would try the hostals on Cervantes street first. The cost here was under 50 Euros. The room was very clean and the bathroom also was modern and clean. Good hot water. It had A.C. but really only needed it for an half and hour or so each day. Another plus is that just around the corner is the tourist information center which was nvever crowded. I would have given it a four rating, except for that clacking noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located.Very clean.Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jgbFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hostel is located near to the most important museums, train station, plaza Santa Ana, Alcala gate,etc.Rooms very clean.Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “weekend break”
Reviews.Author: palomablancaAlicante
Reviews.Content: our 3 days in Madrid was made perfect by the location and cleanliness of this hostal, the rooms are small but perfectly adequate, the room was lovely and warm and the bed comfortable, the owner very helpful and allowed us to leave our cases there on the last day so we could sightsee, its a 5 min walk from the metro which brought us from the airport, a very easy journey. no cafeteria but there are plenty of early morning bars for breakfast and many fab places to eat dinner, all in all a most enjoyable break.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, quiet and centrally situated little hostal”
Reviews.Author: hispanophileTarn
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Armesto. It's very well-located, on the first floor of an old building and within a very short distance of the 3 main art galleries and the bars and restaurants of the Santa Ana area as well as all the lively, bustling places and public transport facilities in the centre of Madrid. However, despite being only yards from the Plaza de Cortes, the calle San Agustin is very quiet. We had also taken the precaution of asking for a room overlooking the gardens, which meant that we had no problem sleeping, even with the window open. The room, though small, is perfectly adequate and that and the en suite bathroom were spotlessly clean. There is a TV with Spanish channels, a functioning safe in the wardrobe and a ceiling fan which we were surprised to have to use because of the unexpectedly hot weather. The owner is friendly, helpful and discreet. All in all, we would not hesitate to return to this hostal.

Reviews.Title: “El corazon de la movida”
Reviews.Author: LudiRoma
Reviews.Content: Overall impression: Nice, cozy and super super clean. Well located and quiet althought very central. Puts off: The room we were - near the kitchen - is kind of small and there is no lift (the hostal is @ 2° floor). Luca - Roma

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean rooms and a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a great trip to Madrid, where we stayed at the small Hostal Armesto. The hostal is located very conveniently in the small and quiet Calle San Agustin next to the Spanish parliament and within a short walking distance to Plaza del Sol. The Hostal has eight rooms of which some are facing the garden. Apparently these should be the better rooms but we where very satisfied with ours that faced the street. However there was some noise for a few hours Saturday night from the restaurant across the street. The spotlessly clean rooms are big enough if you don’t plan to spend too much time in the hotel and they all have private bathrooms and balconies. Moreover the interior of the hostal was much nicer than what you might expect at a price like this. I do not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone who is planning to go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly, great location, not completely quiet”
Reviews.Author: lgalvin
Reviews.Content: The hostal's owners are very friendly and helpful. The location is great, one block from the Prado. The rooms are clean, with hot, if small, showers, efficient heat, cable TV, reading light, small balconies overlooking the street. Across the street is a large library and a couple good restaurants. Also, the in room safe worked. It could have been my jetlag, but I heard noise most of the night, even with earplugs. The upstairs neighbors moved their chairs on the tile for seemingly hours, I could hear the pipes, with the heat expanding them, making a pinging sound and my room, as the photo shows, was righ off the attractive lobby and I could hear one loud chatty guest go on and on. Outside, partiers walked to and from clubs, and trash is collected before dawn twice a week. That being said, I asked other people and they said that all of Madrid was this loud and maybe an inside room would have been quiet.
